newsitem.title: USA: Florida board told to rehear FPL orimulsion plan.
newsitem.headline: Florida board told to rehear FPL orimulsion plan.

text.p: Florida Power & Light Co said a Florida appeals court ruled Wednesday the company should get a second chance to present its proposal to burn orimulsion to Gov. Lawton Chiles and the Cabinet, which initially rejected the project by a 4-3 vote a year ago.

The decision from the First District Court of Appeals states that the governor and the Cabinet, sitting as the Power Plant Siting Board, could override the positive findings of a state hearing officer only if those findings "were not based on competent substantial evidence."

During a two-year application process, numerous government agencies and a state hearing officer who evaluated significant scientific testimony all recommended approval of the FPL Group Inc subsidiary's project, the utility noted.
It proposes to burn orimulsion instead of residual fuel oil at its power plant in Manatee County.

Orimulsion is a mixture of water and hydrocarbons from Venezuela's Orinoco Tar Belt that would be produced in a $320 million processing plant planned by DuPont Co's Conoco, Norway's Statoil and Venezuela's Bitumenes de Orinoco.
